page.title: 04Transport survey in Halewood
page.content: We questioned a number of local families to see how they used the public transport in the area. Out of the forty four families that were questioned only two did not use any form of public transport. All the local buses are used. The buses to Liverpool city centre are the services most commonly used. Also very well used are the services to local shopping centres and markets. Thirty eight families use the buses once a week or more, only two families use the services less than once a week. We were surprised to see that there were very few complaints about services. The main complaints were poor timekeeping and overcrowding. The main reason the buses are used so well is that of the families questioned only eight had a car.
